de.hu.gralog.graph.alg
Class AlgorithmResult

java.lang.Object
  de.hu.gralog.graph.alg.AlgorithmResult
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AlgorithmResult
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class basically serves as a container for AlgorithmResultContent's. It also holds global information which is shared along all contents like a description, displaymodes for subgraphs and element-tips.

An AlgorithmResult consists either of

  • a single content, see setSingleContent(AlgorithmResultContent)
  • a list of contents, see setContentList(ArrayList)
  • a tree of contents, see setContentTree(AlgorithmResultContentTreeNode)

GraLog display's one content at a time but allows the user to switch between different contents. Each content consists of a graph, a list of subgraphs and a list of so called element-tips. AlgorithmResult stores the contents together with the displaying-modes for all subgraphs and element-tips contained in any content. So suppose you decide to display a certain subgraph and you want to highlight all vertices contained in this subgraph. Then the first thing you have to do is to define a DisplaySubgraph.DisplaySubgraphMode and add it to your result, like this: 

                AlgorithmResult result = new AlgorithmResult();
 
                DisplaySubgraphMode mode = new DisplaySubgraphMode();
                mode.setVertexDisplayMode( DisplayMode.HIGH1, DisplayMode.SHOW );
                result.addDisplaySubgraphMode( "a description for your subgraph", mode );

Note that the description given in #addDisplaySubgraphMode(String, DisplaySubgraphMode) also acts as identifier for this subgraph. So when you add the actual subgraph to your content via AlgorithmResultContent.addDisplaySubgraph(String, org.jgrapht.graph.Subgraph) you have to use the same description again.

Author:
ordyniak

Contructs an AlgorithmResult for a given graph. The graph is used as the default graph for contents which have no graph attached.

public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
Sets the description of this Result, which is displayed in GraLog. The description can be given as html.

Parameters:
description - an html string

Returns:

addElementTipsDisplayMode

public void addElementTipsDisplayMode(java.lang.String description,
                                      ElementTips.ElementTipsDisplayMode mode)
Add an elementtip-mode to this result. If an elementtip-mode under the same description already exists the mode is overriden. Please note that when adding the corresponding element-tip to your content via AlgorithmResultContent.addElementTips(String, Hashtable) you have to use the same description.

Parameters:
description - - A description for this elementtip-mode which is displayed in gralog.
mode - - An elementtip-mode which is used for all elementtips with the same description.

addDisplaySubgraphMode

public void addDisplaySubgraphMode(java.lang.String description,
                                   DisplaySubgraph.DisplaySubgraphMode subgraph)
Add a subgraph-mode to this result. If a subgraph-mode under the same description already exists the mode is overriden. Please note that when adding the corresponding subgraph to your content via AlgorithmResultContent.addDisplaySubgraph(String, org.jgrapht.graph.Subgraph) you have to use the same description.

Parameters:
description - - A description for this subgraph-mode which is displayed in gralog.
mode - - A subgraph-mode which is used for all subgraphs with the same description.

getElementTipsDisplayModes

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,ElementTips.ElementTipsDisplayMode> getElementTipsDisplayModes()
Returns:
a Hashtable containing all stored element-tips displaymodes together with their descriptions

Returns:
a Hashtable containing all stored subgraph displaymodes together with their descriptions
